Subjective: Difficulty passing hard stools for ~3 months. Bowel movements every 2-3 days. Associated with abdominal cramps, bloating, and a swollen stomach. Chronic poor appetite and underweight status, but weight is stable. Tried olive oil with some benefit. Family Hx: Sister with ulcerative colitis. No blood in stool, no recent weight loss, no changes in diet or urination. Regular menses. Request: Wants to know if condition is serious and how to soften stool.
Objective: Abdomen: Visibly bloated/distended. Bowel sounds normal. Percussion: Varying tympany, with dampening in LLQ. Palpation: Tender in LLQ. Non-tender in epigastrium and RLQ. No renal lodge tenderness.
Assessment: Suspected Irritable Bowel Syndrome with constipation (IBS-C). No alarm symptoms noted.
Plan: Start Psyllium fibre sachets daily with plenty of water.
Discussed dietitian referral for underweight status, to be addressed at next visit.
Safety Netting: Return sooner for worsening abdominal pain, fever, or significant blood in stool.
Follow-up in 6 weeks to evaluate response to treatment.
